content.content:
CREATE TABLE results
(
    resultId        INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    raceId          INTEGER default 0  not null,
    driverId        INTEGER default 0  not null,
    constructorId   INTEGER default 0  not null,
    number          INTEGER,
    grid            INTEGER default 0  not null,
    position        INTEGER,
    positionText    TEXT    default '' not null,
    positionOrder   INTEGER default 0  not null,
    points          REAL   default 0  not null,
    laps            INTEGER default 0  not null,
    time            TEXT,
    milliseconds    INTEGER,
    fastestLap      INTEGER,
    rank            INTEGER default 0,
    fastestLapTime  TEXT,
    fastestLapSpeed TEXT,
    statusId        INTEGER default 0  not null,
    foreign key (raceId) references races(raceId),
    foreign key (driverId) references drivers(driverId),
    foreign key (constructorId) references constructors(constructorId),
    foreign key (statusId) references status(statusId)
);

input.command: sqlite3 /Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/formula_1.sqlite "SELECT MIN(fastestLapTime) FROM results WHERE driverId = 1 AND fastestLapTime IS NOT NULL;"
input.description: Find Lewis Hamilton's fastest lap time

content.text:
Hamilton's fastest lap time recorded in the database is **1:07.411**, which is 1 minute 7.411 seconds. This is **faster** than 1 minute 8 seconds.

The claim states "Hamilton has never recorded a race lap faster than 1 minute 8 seconds," but the data shows he has recorded a lap of 1:07.411, which is indeed faster than 1:08.000. This directly contradicts the claim.
